numbered_ace_sentences: 2. Developing countries generally have an optimistic attitude.
4. The sample group of 15-24-year-old persons does not have sufficient experience.
5. An elder person has more experience than a 15-24-year-old person.
6. A 15-24-year-old person cannot evaluate differences between the past and the present well.
7. For most teenagers, the age from 16 years to 18 years is more likely an age of mature consciousness.
8. The data in the graph is biased.
9. You ask how this relates to me and my community.
10. The economic environment damages the confidence of working-age persons.
11. You ask what is going on in this graph.
12. The graph shows global social expectancy for different age groups.
13. The headline is: Global social expectancy for different age groups.
